sen.j: 練り切り（ねりきり）は、白餡に 求肥（ぎゅうひ：蒸すかゆでた白玉粉や餅米の粉に、砂糖や水飴を加えて練ったもの）やツクネイモを混ぜて練った生菓子の和菓子である。
sen.e: Nerikiri (literally, made by kneading) is a fresh and moist type of Japanese confectionery made from white bean jam, gyuhi (a kind of rice cake made from glutinous rice or glutinous rice flour) and Chinese yam, and by mixing and kneading them.

Nerikiri (literally, made by kneading) is a fresh and moist type of Japanese confectionery made from white bean jam, gyuhi (a kind of rice cake made from refined rice flouror or glutinous rice flour with sugar and starch syrup) and Chinese yam, and by mixing and kneading them.

sen.e: Nerikiri (literally, made by kneading) is a Japanese type of unbaked cake that is made by mixing and kneading its ingredients, which are white bean jam, gyuhi (a kind of rice cake made from refined rice flour or glutinous rice flour with sugar and starch syrup) and Chinese yam.
